Articles.Content:
I keep having my action groups act weird lately with them not respecting symmetry.

I'm trying to get a rocketplane to do a once-around (not an orbit, just a flight around the world to land back at KSP) and about half the time when I hit the action group I set up to shut down the jet engines, one side doesn't respond and keeps burning... the resulting asymmetric thrust puts me into a flat spin and I have to eject every time that happens. Very frustrating.

Is there something that causes action groups to "forget" that there are two engines in a particular selection, or what could I be doing to cause this?

-- Steve

Edited July 27, 2013 by Anton P. Nym
Taking off and replacing symmetry enabled parts has messed up the action groups in my experience, redoing them after tweaking the construction generally fixes it.

Before leaving the VAB always check 3 things:

1. staging

2. action groups

3. crew

It looks like I have to clear all my action groups whenever I adjust the aircraft if it'll affect a part using symmetry. Alas, the preview will show both engines as effected, but runway tests show you're right. (Dammit.) Good to know; now I have a chance at that one-around.

-- Steve

I don't see that this bug is answered here. There's a "workaround" yes, by checking and rebuilding action groups. But since this workaround is annoying and losing part of the group isn't the intended behavior of the feature it is still an open bug. I can reproduce this bug in .21.1 without removing or moving any parts. Simply reverting to the hangar and then relaunching will cause this bug to manifest. Not every time, but frequently. I have no addons installed. This is a bug I have experienced since at least .19, and maybe even .18

I guess the categorization in the forum is not like what I'm used to in development bug trackers. Thanks for the clarification.

Is there any place we can go to see if squad acknowledges the bug and to check progress?

Thanks!
